intro: Rhexia agrestis, commonly known as the marsh pink, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks, thriving in moist, acidic soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Rhexia agrestis plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
